model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I've heard that Boy Scouts teaches a lot of survival skills like setting up shelter and figuring out how to get a fire started no matter what materials you have on hand. Have you done any of that? I'm sure my kids would love roughing it.

MEMORY:
User Description: Speaker B works at a fast food place and loves ice cream. Speaker B hasn't started college yet but hopes to become an Eagle Scout. Speaker B uses scouts to make friends and has been involved with Boy Scouts for 7-8 years. 

Relationship Description: Speaker B is interested in volunteering at Speaker A's church and has done a lot of volunteer work in Boy Scouts. Speaker B wants to come to the church retreat and thinks twins are little angels. 

Event Description: Speaker A manages work, school, and scouts. Speaker A wants triplets for the choir and needs more volunteers for the retreat. Speaker A mentions a youth retreat next month and bringing babies to the retreat. Speaker B's work is going well, and the hardest part is managing scouts, work, and school. Speaker B plans to attend the local community college and get his Eagle Scout badge.

raw_prediction: Speaker B: I haven't started college yet, but I've been involved with Boy Scouts for about 7-8 years now. It's been a great experience for me, not only for learning survival skills like setting up shelter and starting a fire, but also for developing social skills. Working together and compromising are key aspects of being a Scout. I think your kids would really enjoy it, and it's a great way for them to learn and have fun at the same time.
